repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - National Protected Areas
            Conservation Trust Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the National Protected Areas
            Conservation Trust Fund Project for Colombia were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk to global
            environment outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: the mosaic conservation
            concept, when designed and applied with the necessary due
            diligence, strict oversight and extensive level of local
            participation, does produce significant conservation
            benefits. The project served as the very first trial of this
            idea and then further replicated it during the additional
            financing. Local participation as well as a solid strategy
            for continuous communication and dissemination was the key
            to promote local buy-in and appropriation of project
            activities. World Bank and global environment facility
            (GEF)-supported trust funds were taken into account during
            the project design, and indeed contributed to paving the way
            for the successful establishment and growth of Patrimonio
            Natural, a trust fund that ultimately transcended its
            original project management role and became a significant
            fixture in the funding of Colombia’s protected area (PA) system.

repnme.cdata!:
Colombian - Colombian National Protected
            Areas Conservation Trust Fund Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Colombian National Protected Areas Conservation Trust Fund
            Project is to launch a conservation trust fund that will:
            support the consolidation of Colombia's national
            protected areas system; and contribute to arrest and reverse
            trends in biodiversity loss. The closing date of the project
            will be extended from October 18, 2011 to April 18, 2012.
            The extension was needed to allow for information sharing
            and learning between the new project areas and the existing
            project. This will be the second extension of the project.
            This extension is required due to the unanticipated
            consequences of the global financial crisis. This request
            for an extension is the consequence of events beyond the
            control of the implementing agency.
